translated: If one is not immutable, then either the knowledge of elimination or the knowledge of nonarising arises immediately after the knowledge of elimination.

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of nonarising does not arise because it is possible to retrogress.

original: ci mi g-yo ba'i chos can la de mi skye ba kho na yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci mi g-yo ba'i chos can la de mi skye ba kho na yin nam zhe na /
translated: Does the unshakable one never produce this cognition?

original: de ni dgra bcom thams cad la //
analyzed: de ni dgra bcom thams cad la //
translated: The unshakable one, like all the others,üîΩsometimes produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion, sometimes the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of non-arising.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can la yang res 'ga' mi skye ba shes pa las mi skye ba shes pa kho na skye la /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can la yang res 'ga' mi skye ba shes pa las mi skye ba shes pa kho na skye la /
translated: Sometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of exhaustion, sometimes the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of non-arising.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of non-arising, sometimes the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of non-arising, sometimes the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of exhaustion.

original: res 'ga' mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //üîΩgang dag 'bras bu bzhir bshad pa de dag gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: res 'ga' mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o // gang dag 'bras bu bzhir bshad pa de dag gang gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: Sometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Sometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /üîΩdge sbyong tshul ni dri med lam //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na / dge sbyong tshul ni dri med lam //
translated: Sometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ni zag pa med pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ni zag pa med pa'i lam yin no //
translated: Sometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.

analyzed: des nyon mongs pa zhi bar byed pa'i sgo nas dge sbyong du 'gyur @191b ro ; / dge sbyong gi tshul de'i 'bras bu 'di dag kho na ma yin gyi de ci zhe na /
translated: Sometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.

original: 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: Sometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-arising.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion.üîΩSometimes he produces the cognition of non-arising from the cognition of non-

original: de dag brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: de dag brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: These are the eighty-nine.

original: grol lam zad pa rnams dang bcas //
analyzed: grol lam zad pa rnams dang bcas //
translated: The paths of liberation of the adept are the pure aggregates.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bar byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba re re zhing yang nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu spong bar byed pa'i de snyed kho na'i rnam par grol ba'i lam dag ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bar byed pa'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong ba re re zhing yang nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu spong bar byed pa'i de snyed kho na'i rnam par grol ba'i lam dag ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas pa dag yin no //
translated: The eight paths of liberation that eliminate the factors to be eliminated by the path of seeing and the same number of paths of liberation that eliminate the ninefold classes of defilements to be eliminated by the path of cultivation are the conditioned results of the training.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag gi spangs pa ni 'bras bu 'dus ma byas pa dag yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag gi spangs pa ni 'bras bu 'dus ma byas pa dag yin no //
translated: The abandonment of those defilements is the unconditioned result.

original: 'o na sngar gyi dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhi bshad pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sngar gyi dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu bzhi bshad pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can this be reconciled with the earlier explanation of the four results of the training?

original: de dag la ni 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de dag la ni 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: 'bras bu bzhi rnam gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi rnam gzhag pa ni //
translated: the four results are established

original: rgyu lnga dag ni srid phyir ro //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu lnga dag ni srid phyir ro //üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: because the five causes are possible.üîΩWhat are the five causes?

original: 'bras la sngon lam btang ba dang // gzhan thob pa dang zad bsdoms dang // shes pa brgyad mtshan thob pa dang // rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras la sngon lam btang ba dang // gzhan thob pa dang zad bsdoms dang // shes pa brgyad mtshan thob pa dang // rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'o //
translated: The result is the relinquishment of the former path, the obtainment of another, the combination of eliminations, the obtainment of the characteristics of the eight knowledges, and the obtainment of the sixteen aspects.

original: lam snga ma btang ba dang sngon med pa'i lam thob pa ni zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i lam btang ba dang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam snga ma btang ba dang sngon med pa'i lam thob pa ni zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i lam btang ba dang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The relinquishment of the former path and the obtainment of a former non-existent path is due to the relinquishment and obtainment of the paths of entry and result.

original: spangs pa bsdoms pa dang / thams cad kyi bral ba gcig gi thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa bsdoms pa dang / thams cad kyi bral ba gcig gi thob pa rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The combination of eliminations is due to the obtainment of the single obtainment of the complete separation from all.

original: shes pa brgyad cig car du thob pa ni chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad cig car du thob pa ni chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The simultaneous obtainment of the eight knowledges is the four aspects of Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.

original: rnam pa bcu drug thob pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug thob pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag go //
translated: The obtainment of the sixteen aspects is the aspects of impermanence and so on.

original: rgyu lnga po de dag yin te /
analyzed: rgyu lnga po de dag yin te /
translated: These are the five causes.

original: gang dag gi 'bras bu bzhir rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag gi 'bras bu bzhir rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that the four results are posited due to these.

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i lam kho na dge sbyong gi tshul yin na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bur rung zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i lam kho na dge sbyong gi tshul yin na 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bur rung zhe na /
translated: If the path of no-more-learning alone is the state of a sramanera, how can the two results obtained by the mundane path be results of the state of a sramanera?

original: 'jig rten pa yis thob 'bras ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yis thob 'bras ni //
translated: The results obtained by the mundane path

original: bsres dang zag med thob 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: bsres dang zag med thob 'dzin phyir //
translated: are mixed with the uncontaminated obtainment of the result.

original: de la mthong ba'i lam gyis 'bras bu spangs pa yang der bsre bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i lam gyis 'bras bu spangs pa yang der bsre bar bya ste /
translated: The abandonment obtained by the path of seeing is mixed with that result,

original: thams cad kyi thob pa de'i 'bras bu bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thob pa de'i 'bras bu bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obtainment of all is obtained as one result.

original: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of once-returner?

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams bsrabs pa gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams bsrabs pa gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: It is the abandonment of the three fetters and the reduction of attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the result of non-returner?

original: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i lnga spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i lnga spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the abandonment of the five lower fetters.

original: zag pa med pa'i bral ba thob pas kyang /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bral ba thob pas kyang /
translated: And by obtaining the uncontaminated separation from the defilements,

original: spangs pa de 'dzin par yang byed de /
analyzed: spangs pa de 'dzin par yang byed de /
translated: one also maintains that abandonment.

original: de'i stobs kyis yongs su nyams pa mi 'chi ba'i phyir @192a * //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis yongs su nyams pa mi 'chi ba'i phyir @192a * //
translated: Because one does not retrogress through the power of that.

original: ro ; /'di'i phyir yang 'di dge sbyong gi 'bras bu nyid du rigs so //üîΩdge sbyong gi tshul du bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: ro ; /'di'i phyir yang 'di dge sbyong gi 'bras bu nyid du rigs so // dge sbyong gi tshul du bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: For this reason, it is logical that it is the fruit of the sramana.

original: de nyid tshangs tshul tshangs pa yi //
analyzed: de nyid tshangs tshul tshangs pa yi //
translated: The path of insight is the wheel of the Dharma,

original: 'khor lo tshangs pas bskor phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo tshangs pas bskor phyir ro //
translated: because it is like a wheel,üîΩand because it is turned by the Buddha, the Lord of the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshangs pa'i tshul bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir tshangs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshangs pa'i tshul bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir tshangs pa yin te /
translated: The Blessed One is Brahma because he possesses the unsurpassed Dharma of Brahma.

original: 'khor lo 'di ni de'i yin pas na tshangs pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo 'di ni de'i yin pas na tshangs pa'i ste /
translated: This is the wheel of Brahma,

original: des bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is turned by him.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam rgyu bas na 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam rgyu bas na 'khor lo'o //
translated: The path of insight is the wheel of the Dharma, because it is like a wheel, since it moves, and because it is turned by the Buddha, the Lord of the Dharma.

original: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam ni chos kyi 'khor lo yin no //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam ni chos kyi 'khor lo yin no //
translated: The path of insight is the wheel of the Dharma, because it is similar to a wheel.

original: 'di'i chos mthun pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i chos mthun pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it similar?

original: myur bar 'gro sogs rtsibs sogs phyir //
analyzed: myur bar 'gro sogs rtsibs sogs phyir //
translated: The wheel is the path of seeing, because it quickly proceeds and so on, like a wheel.

original: myur du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / 'dor ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ma rgyal ba las rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyal ba rnal du 'god pa'i phyir dang / 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / 'dor ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ma rgyal ba las rgyal bar byed pa'i phyir dang / rgyal ba rnal du 'god pa'i phyir dang / 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir te /
translated: It quickly proceeds, it is set in motion, it conquers the unconquered, it re-conquers what has been conquered, it raises up what has been conquered, and it sets down what has been raised up.

original: myur bar 'gro ba la sogs pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: myur bar 'gro ba la sogs pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: It quickly proceeds and so on, because it is like a wheel.

original: rtsibs la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir 'khor lo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtsibs la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir 'khor lo zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called a wheel because it is similar to a wheel.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang ; rtsol ba dang / dran pa ni rtsibs lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang ; rtsol ba dang / dran pa ni rtsibs lta bu yin no //
translated: Right view, thought, effort, and mindfulness are like spokes.

original: yang dag pa'i dag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams ni lte ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams ni lte ba lta bu yin no //
translated: Right speech, action, and livelihood are like the hub.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu yin no //
translated: Concentration is like the rim.

original: yang khams gang du dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu thob ce na /üîΩ'dod par gsum thob /
analyzed: yang khams gang du dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu thob ce na / 'dod par gsum thob /
translated: In which realm does one obtain the fruits of asceticism?üîΩThree are obtained in the desire realm.

original: gsum po ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar 'thob po ;
analyzed: gsum po ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar 'thob po ;
translated: Three are obtained only in the desire realm.

original: / tha ma ni gsum du'o //
analyzed: / tha ma ni gsum du'o //
translated: The third is obtained in three stages.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ni khams gsum du 'thob bo //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ni khams gsum du 'thob bo //
translated: The state of arhat is obtained in the three realms.

original: re zhig 'bras bu gnyis ni 'dod chags dang ma bral bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gong mar mi thob par yang rigs pa na gsum pa go ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu gnyis ni 'dod chags dang ma bral bas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir gong mar mi thob par yang rigs pa na gsum pa go ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
translated: The first two fruits are not obtained in higher stages, because they are obtained by those who are not detached from the realm of desire. But why is the third fruit not obtained in higher stages?

original: gong na mthong lam med /
analyzed: gong na mthong lam med /
translated: The path of insight does not exist in higher stages.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las gong na ni mthong ba'i lam med la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las gong na ni mthong ba'i lam med la /
translated: The path of insight does not exist in the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality.

original: de med par yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa med pas zhes bya ba 'di re zhig rigs pa yin no //üîΩmi skyo lud las 'dir rtsom zhing /
analyzed: de med par yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa med pas zhes bya ba 'di re zhig rigs pa yin no // mi skyo lud las 'dir rtsom zhing /
translated: It is reasonable that the fruit of non-returner is not obtained in these stages, because one is not detached from the realm of desire without the path of insight.

original: der mthar phyin zhes 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: der mthar phyin zhes 'byung phyir ro //
translated: The ordinary worldling who is in the realm of fine-materiality begins his work here, i.e., the preparatory practice for the attainment of the fruit of non-returner; he finishes it there, i.e., in the realm of immateriality.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la chags pa'i phyir dang / kun du mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la chags pa'i phyir dang / kun du mi skyo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said: ‚ÄúThe ordinary worldling does not become detached from the realm of desire through the mundane path, because he is attached to the pleasure of meditative attainment and because he is not disgusted with the realm of desire.‚Äù

original: phyir mi 'ong ba lnga ni 'di rtsom pa ni lam rtsom pa ste der mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba lnga ni 'di rtsom pa ni lam rtsom pa ste der mthar phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The five nonreturners are those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana as soon as they are born, those who attain nirvana with effort, those who attain nirvana without effort and those who proceed higher.

original: de bas na de la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu med de //
analyzed: de bas na de la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu med de //
translated: Therefore nonreturners do not exist there.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: As the Abhidharmakosa states:

original: gal te mi g-yo'i zad shes las //
analyzed: gal te mi g-yo'i zad shes las //
translated: If nonreturners are classified by intellectual faculty,

original: mi skye'i blo gros zhes bshad de //
analyzed: mi skye'i blo gros zhes bshad de //
translated: they are explained as six: three of sharp faculty and three of dull faculty.

original: ci dgra bcom pa la yang dbye ba yod dam zhe na /üîΩsmras @192b pa ;
analyzed: ci dgra bcom pa la yang dbye ba yod dam zhe na / smras @192b pa ;
translated: Are arhats classified?

original: yod de / dgra bcom drug 'dod //
analyzed: yod de / dgra bcom drug 'dod //
translated: They are said to be six:

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang // 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang // rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang // gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang // rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang // 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang // rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang // gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang // rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: those liable to occasional transgression, those liable to degeneration, those capable of penetrating insight, those capable of the summit, those capable of enduring patience and those of unshakable nature.

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: Among them,

original: lnga ni dad pa'i mos las skyes //üîΩmi g-yo ba'i chos can ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga ni dad pa'i mos las skyes // mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: five arise from the liberated by faith.üîΩThey are liberated by both parts.

original: de dag rnam grol dus dang sbyor //
analyzed: de dag rnam grol dus dang sbyor //
translated: They are liberated by the occasion.

original: lnga po de dag gi rnam par grol ba ni dus dang sbyor bas phangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po de dag gi rnam par grol ba ni dus dang sbyor bas phangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The liberation of the first five is called timely because it is not lost.

original: rtag tu rjes su srung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su srung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not lost because it is always guarded.

original: mi g-yo'i chos can mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: mi g-yo'i chos can mi g-yo ba //
translated: The steadfast one is unshakable.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i sgo nas g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir de dus mi sbyor grol //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i sgo nas g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir de dus mi sbyor grol //
translated: He is unshakable because he cannot be moved from his stage by any cause.üîΩTherefore, he is liberated independent of circumstances.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: For that reason, he is called one liberated independent of circumstances.

original: yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni mthong thob rgyu las byung //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro // de ni mthong thob rgyu las byung //
translated: He is not subject to retrogressing.üîΩHe is a candidate for the fruit of stream-enterer.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de ni mthong bas thob pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de ni mthong bas thob pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The steadfast one is preceded by the one who obtains through insight.

original: ci dgra bcom pa 'di dag dang po kho na nas de dag gi rigs can zhig yin nam /
analyzed: ci dgra bcom pa 'di dag dang po kho na nas de dag gi rigs can zhig yin nam /
translated: Are these perfected beings of this type from the very beginning?

original: 'on te phyis yin zhe na /üîΩkha cig dang po nas de'i rigs /
analyzed: 'on te phyis yin zhe na / kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs /
translated: Or do they later become of this type?üîΩSome are of this type from the very beginning.

original: kha cig sbyangs pa las gyur to //
analyzed: kha cig sbyangs pa las gyur to //
translated: Some become of this type through purification.

original: kha cig ni dang po nyid nas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs can yin la /
