analyzed: rnam par grol ba las ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Those who are liberated by wisdom are based on the meditative development of liberation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par grol ba las ni gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par grol ba las ni gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: Those who are doubly released are based on the meditative development of both the attainment and liberation.

original: ming gi sgo nas ni gang zag de bdun yin no //
analyzed: ming gi sgo nas ni gang zag de bdun yin no //
translated: In terms of name, these individuals are seven in number.

original: de dag drug / rdzas su ni de dag drug yin no //
analyzed: de dag drug / rdzas su ni de dag drug yin no //
translated: In terms of substance, they are six.

original: 'di ltar lam gsum la gnyis gnyis //
analyzed: 'di ltar lam gsum la gnyis gnyis //
translated: Two in each of the three vehicles.

original: mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam gyi sngar bshad pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang sgom pa'i lam gyi sngar bshad pa bzhi'o //
translated: The path of insight and the path of cultivation are as previously explained.

original: mi slob pa'i lam la ni dus dang sbyor ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bas rnam par grol ba'o //üîΩgnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni gang shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam la ni dus dang sbyor ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bas rnam par grol ba'o // gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni gang shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: The path of no-more-learning is the liberation of the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of faith and the one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom.üîΩThe one who is liberated through both parts is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom.

original: 'gog thob gnyis ka las rnam grol //üîΩgang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de ni gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gog thob gnyis ka las rnam grol // gang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de ni gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba yin te /
translated: The one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who is liberated through the two, the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.üîΩThe one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.üîΩThe one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //üîΩshes rab kyis ni cig shos so //üîΩshes rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'ba' zhig las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro // shes rab kyis ni cig shos so // shes rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'ba' zhig las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.üîΩThe one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.üîΩThe one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.üîΩThe one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.üîΩThe one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.üîΩThe one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance of concentration and the one who has attained the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: ji tsam gyis slob pa dang mi slob pa yongs su rdzogs she na /üîΩsnyoms 'jug dbang po 'bras rnams kyi //
analyzed: ji tsam gyis slob pa dang mi slob pa yongs su rdzogs she na /üîΩsnyoms 'jug dbang po 'bras rnams kyi //
translated: The one who is liberated through predominance of wisdom is the one who is liberated through the two, the one who is liberated through predominance

original: slob pa yongs rdzogs shes bya'o //
analyzed: slob pa yongs rdzogs shes bya'o //
translated: The perfected being in training is called a knower.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa las ni 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa las ni 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa thob pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of absorption, the perfected being in training is the person who has acquired the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: dbang po las ni mthong bas thob pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po las ni mthong bas thob pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of the controlling faculties, the perfected being in training is the person who has attained through insight.

original: 'bras bu las ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu las ni phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: From the point of view of the fruits, the perfected being in training is the nonreturner.

original: de ltar na slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the perfected being in training is defined by the combination of five factors.

original: gnyis kyis mi slob yongs su rdzogs //
analyzed: gnyis kyis mi slob yongs su rdzogs //
translated: The perfected being beyond training is defined by two factors.

original: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag las so //
analyzed: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag las so //
translated: From the point of view of the controlling faculties and from the point of view of absorption.

original: lam de yang rnam pa mang po zhig yin te /
analyzed: lam de yang rnam pa mang po zhig yin te /
translated: The path is of many types.

original: mdor na lam ni rnam bzhi ste //
analyzed: mdor na lam ni rnam bzhi ste //
translated: In brief, the path is of four types:

original: khyad par can dang rnam grol dang // bar chad med dang sbyor zhes bya //üîΩsbyor ba'i lam ni gang gi mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can dang rnam grol dang // bar chad med dang sbyor zhes bya // sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gi mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba'o //
translated: the path of application, the immediate path, the path of liberation, the special path.üîΩThe path of application is the path by which the immediate path arises.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa rab tu spong ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa rab tu spong ba'o //
translated: The immediate path is the path by which the obstacle is abandoned.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni des spong bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba dang po nyid du skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni des spong bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol ba dang po nyid du skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The path of liberation is the first arising of the path in the absence of the obstacle to be abandoned by it.

original: khyad @194b par can gyi lam ni de las gzhan pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: khyad @194b par can gyi lam ni de las gzhan pa'i lam mo //
translated: The special path is the path subsequent to that.

original: yang lam nyid mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir sgrub pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang lam nyid mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir sgrub pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Also, the path is called ‚Äúpractice‚Äù because it is the means of attaining nirvana.

original: sgrub pa bzhi zhes gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: sgrub pa bzhi zhes gsungs pa de la /
translated: The four practices are mentioned.

original: bsam gtan dag gi lam rnams sla //
analyzed: bsam gtan dag gi lam rnams sla //
translated: The paths of the meditations are easy,

original: yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dag gis 'bad mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dag gis 'bad mi dgos par rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are endowed with the members and because serenity and insight occur spontaneously without effort, being equalized.

original: sa gzhan dag gi dka' ba yin //
analyzed: sa gzhan dag gi dka' ba yin //
translated: The others are difficult.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams la bsgrub par dka' ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa rnams la bsgrub par dka' ba ni de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The difficult practice is the opposite of that in the preliminary stage and so on.

original: sgrub pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩblo rtul mngon shes bul ba ste //
analyzed: sgrub pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te / blo rtul mngon shes bul ba ste //
translated: This practice is twofold:üîΩThe dull-witted one has slow superknowledge.

original: cig shos kyis ni mngon shes myur //
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni mngon shes myur //
translated: The other one has quick superknowledge.

original: dbang po rtul po ni sgrub par sla ba'am dka' yang rung ste /üîΩmngon par shes pa bul ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po ni sgrub par sla ba'am dka' yang rung ste / mngon par shes pa bul ba yin no //
translated: The weak faculties are slow in superknowledge, whether realization is easy or difficult.

original: dbang po rnon po ni mngon par shes pa myur ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni mngon par shes pa myur ba yin no //
translated: The sharp faculties are quick in superknowledge.

original: de ltar na sgrub pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sgrub pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: This is the basis of realization.

original: yang lam de nyid byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun du gsungs te /
analyzed: yang lam de nyid byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun du gsungs te /
translated: This path is also said to be the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: de la zad dang mi skye shes pa ni //
analyzed: de la zad dang mi skye shes pa ni //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonproduction is enlightenment.

original: byang chub ; zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni gang zag gi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: byang chub ; zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni gang zag gi bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and nonproduction is threefold according to the distinctions of the person.

original: de dang mthun nyid phyir /
analyzed: de dang mthun nyid phyir /
translated: Because they are concordant with that,

original: sum cu rtsa bdun de'i phyogs mthun /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun de'i phyogs mthun /
translated: the thirty-seven are concordant with enlightenment.

original: byang chub dang mthun pa'i phyir /üîΩming gi sgo nas /
analyzed: byang chub dang mthun pa'i phyir / ming gi sgo nas /
translated: Because they are concordant with enlightenment,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: rdzas su bcu /
analyzed: rdzas su bcu /
translated: In substance, they are ten.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad ni rdzas bcu po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad ni rdzas bcu po 'di lta ste /
translated: All the factors of enlightenment are ten substances.

original: dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // shes rab ting 'dzin btang snyoms dga' //
analyzed: dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // shes rab ting 'dzin btang snyoms dga' //
translated: Faith, effort, mindfulness,üîΩconcentration, equanimity, joy,

original: rtog dang tshul khrims shin tu sbyangs //
analyzed: rtog dang tshul khrims shin tu sbyangs //
translated: investigation, and pliancy.

original: de ltar de dag ni rdzas bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni rdzas bcu'o //
translated: Thus they are ten substances.

original: ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How so?

original: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are wisdom,

original: brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
translated: effort is correct abandoning,

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting 'dzin to //
translated: the bases of supernatural powers are concentration.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par rab tu spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dag yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par rab tu spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dag yin no //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness, correct abandoning, and the bases of supernatural powers are, respectively, by nature wisdom, effort, and concentration.

original: de'i phyir re zhig dbang po dang stobs ni ming gis smos la /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig dbang po dang stobs ni ming gis smos la /
translated: Therefore the faculties and powers are mentioned by name.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rdzas lnga yin te /
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi rdzas lnga yin te /
translated: They are five substances: faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni shes rab kho na yin no //üîΩyang dag par rab tu spong ba rnams dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang @195a * //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni shes rab kho na yin no // yang dag par rab tu spong ba rnams dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang @195a * //
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness, the member of enlightenment that is the investigation of phenomena, and right view are simply wisdom.

original: dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus kho na yin no //
analyzed: dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus kho na yin no //
translated: The four right efforts, the member of enlightenment that is energy, and right exertion are simply energy.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin no //
translated: The four bases of supernatural powers, the member of enlightenment that is concentration, and right concentration are simply concentration.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa ni dran pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa ni dran pa kho na yin no //
translated: The member of enlightenment that is mindfulness, and right mindfulness are simply mindfulness.

original: ci zhig lus she na /
analyzed: ci zhig lus she na /
translated: What remains?

original: dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnams ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba rnams ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag ste /
translated: The branches of morality are the right endeavors, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the right view, the right mindfulness, the right concentration, the right effort, the right livelihood, and the right resolve.

original: de ltar na bcu yin no //üîΩ'di skad du /
analyzed: de ltar na bcu yin no // 'di skad du /
translated: Thus there are ten.üîΩIt was said above that the applications of mindfulness and so on are by nature wisdom, effort, and concentration.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni shes rab dang brtson 'grus dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dag yin no zhes gang bshad pa des ni /üîΩgtso bo smos pas /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni shes rab dang brtson 'grus dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dag yin no zhes gang bshad pa des ni / gtso bo smos pas /
translated: This was said

original: yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: with reference to their principal natures.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: But they are also

original: sbyor byung yon tan kun kyang yin //üîΩgtso bo smos pas de skad bshad kyi /
analyzed: sbyor byung yon tan kun kyang yin // gtso bo smos pas de skad bshad kyi /
translated: all the qualities that arise from practice.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan thams cad kyang yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan thams cad kyang yin no //
translated: They are also all the qualities that arise from practice.

original: gnas skabs gang du byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa gang zhig rab tu 'byed ce na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang du byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa gang zhig rab tu 'byed ce na /
translated: In what states are the factors of enlightenment distinguished?üîΩThe seven groups are respectively

original: sde tshan bdun ni go rims bzhin //üîΩlas ni dang po pa dag dang // nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang ni //
analyzed: sde tshan bdun ni go rims bzhin // las ni dang po pa dag dang // nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang ni //
translated: the beginners, those with sharp faculties,

original: bsgom dang mthong la rab tu phye //
analyzed: bsgom dang mthong la rab tu phye //
translated: those in training, and those beyond training.

original: las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su ni lus la sogs pa nye bar brtag pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su ni lus la sogs pa nye bar brtag pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are in the state of beginners, because they investigate the body, etc.

original: khyad par thob pas brtson 'grus yang dag par spel ba'i phyir dro bar 'gyur ba dag la ni yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams so //
analyzed: khyad par thob pas brtson 'grus yang dag par spel ba'i phyir dro bar 'gyur ba dag la ni yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams so //
translated: The right efforts are in the state of those with sharp faculties, because they are for the sake of abandoning nonvirtue and increasing virtue.üîΩThe bases of supernatural power are in the state of those who have attained distinction, because they are the cause of attaining the special qualities of higher knowledge, etc.

original: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa'i phyir rtse mo dag la ni /üîΩrdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa'i phyir rtse mo dag la ni / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
translated: The faculties are in the state of those who have attained the summit, because they are the cause of the nondegeneration of the roots of virtue.

original: yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dbang thob pa'i phyir brjod bzod pa dag la ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dbang thob pa'i phyir brjod bzod pa dag la ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: The powers are in the state of those who have attained acceptance of the teachings, because they are the cause of not regressing from the stages of acceptance.üîΩThe limbs of enlightenment are in the state of the path of seeing, because they are the cause of the nondegeneration of the path.üîΩThe path is in the state of the path of meditation, because it is the cause of the abandonment of the remaining obscurations.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir chos mchog dag la ni stobs rnams so //üîΩbyang chub dang nye ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //üîΩ'gro bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la ni lam gyi yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir chos mchog dag la ni stobs rnams so // byang chub dang nye ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so // 'gro bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la ni lam gyi yan lag rnams te /
translated: The powers are on the supreme mundane factors, because one is not crushed by the defilements.

original: de ni myur bar 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni myur bar 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The members of the path are on the path of insight, because it is distinguished by its progress, for it proceeds rapidly.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa du zhig ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa du zhig ni zag pa dang bcas pa yin /
translated: How many of the members of enlightenment and the members of the path are impure?

original: du zhig ni zag pa med pa yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: du zhig ni zag pa med pa yin zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: How many are pure?

original: byang chub yan lag lam yan lag / zag pa med /
analyzed: byang chub yan lag lam yan lag / zag pa med /
translated: The members of enlightenment and the members of the path are pure.

original: de gnyis ni bsgom pa dang mthong ba'i lam la rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni bsgom pa dang mthong ba'i lam la rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are established in the path of cultivation and the path of insight, respectively.

original: @195b gzhan rnams gnyis so //
analyzed: @195b gzhan rnams gnyis so //
translated: The others are of two kinds.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa gzhan dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa gzhan dag ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dag yin no //
translated: The other members of enlightenment and the members of the path are either impure or pure.

original: sa gang na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa du zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: sa gang na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa du zhig yod ce na /
translated: How many aspects of enlightenment are there in which level?

original: bsam gtan dang po na thams cad //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po na thams cad //
translated: All in the first absorption.

original: mi lcogs med na dga' ma gtogs //
analyzed: mi lcogs med na dga' ma gtogs //
translated: In unrestricted access concentration, joy is excluded.

original: nyer bsdogs rnams ni stobs kyis drangs  dgos pa'i phyir dang / sa 'og ma'i dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dga' ba med do //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs rnams ni stobs kyis drangs  dgos pa'i phyir dang / sa 'og ma'i dgos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dga' ba med do //
translated: Joy is excluded in unrestricted access concentration because it must be drawn out by the power of the lower level and it is associated with the purpose of the lower level.

original: gnyis pa na ni rtog ma gtogs //
analyzed: gnyis pa na ni rtog ma gtogs //
translated: In the second, conception is excluded.

original: gnyis pa na yang dag pa'i rtog pa med de /
analyzed: gnyis pa na yang dag pa'i rtog pa med de /
translated: In the second absorption, right conception is excluded.

original: de na rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no conception there.

original: gnyis na de gnyis ma gtogs pa //
analyzed: gnyis na de gnyis ma gtogs pa //
translated: In the two, those two are excluded.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag na ni dga' ba dang rtog pa dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi pa dag na ni dga' ba dang rtog pa dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: In the third and fourth absorptions, joy and conception are excluded.

original: bsam gtan bar na'ang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bar na'ang /
translated: In the intermediate absorption,

original: de gnyis nyid ma gtogs pa sum cu rtsa lnga kho na'o //
analyzed: de gnyis nyid ma gtogs pa sum cu rtsa lnga kho na'o //
translated: only thirty-five are present, excluding those two.

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: In the formless realm,

original: gsum na'ang / de dang tshul yan lag / ma gtogs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gsum na'ang / de dang tshul yan lag / ma gtogs zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: in the three, those two and the branch of the path of right speech and so on are excluded.

original: gzugs med pa gsum na ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams dang / dga' ba dang ; rtog pa dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum na ni yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams dang / dga' ba dang ; rtog pa dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: In the three formless realms, right speech, right action, and right livelihood, right effort, and right mindfulness are absent, as well as joy and initial inquiry.

original: byang chub dang ni lam yan lag //
analyzed: byang chub dang ni lam yan lag //
translated: The limbs of enlightenment and the limbs of the path

original: ma gtogs 'dod khams srid rtse na //
analyzed: ma gtogs 'dod khams srid rtse na //
translated: are absent in the desire realm and the peak of existence.

original: 'dod pa'i khams srid pa'i rtse mo la byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag ma gtogs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams srid pa'i rtse mo la byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi yan lag ma gtogs te /
translated: In the desire realm and the peak of existence, the limbs of enlightenment and the limbs of the path are absent,

original: de dag la zag pa med pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la zag pa med pa'i lam med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the uncontaminated path does not exist there.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la gnas pa gnas skabs gang du shes nas dad pa thob par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa la gnas pa gnas skabs gang du shes nas dad pa thob par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: In what states of abiding in the factors conducive to enlightenment is faith through knowledge obtained?

original: bden gsum mthong na tshul khrims dang // chos la shes nas dad pa thob //
analyzed: bden gsum mthong na tshul khrims dang // chos la shes nas dad pa thob //
translated: When three truths are seen, one obtains faith through knowledge of morality and the Dharma.

original: lam mngon rtogs na sangs rgyas dang // de yi dge 'dun dag la yang //
analyzed: lam mngon rtogs na sangs rgyas dang // de yi dge 'dun dag la yang //
translated: When the path is realized, one obtains faith in the Buddha and his Sa·πÖgha.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs na chos la shes nas dad pa dang / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams thob bo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa'i bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs na chos la shes nas dad pa dang / 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams thob bo //
translated: When one realizes the truths of suffering, origin, and cessation, one obtains faith that is born of insight into the Dharma and the morality that delights the noble ones.

original: lam gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs na sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa thob ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs na sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa thob ste /
translated: When one realizes the truth of the path, one obtains faith that is born of insight into the Buddha and his Sangha of disciples.

original: gang zhig de gnyis la dad pa de ni sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos mi slob pa dang / dge 'dun du byed pa'i chos slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de gnyis la dad pa de ni sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos mi slob pa dang / dge 'dun du byed pa'i chos slob pa dang / mi slob pa rnams la'o //
translated: One who has faith in those two has faith in the factors that make one a buddha, which are the nonlearner dharmas, and in the factors that make one a member of the Sangha, which are the learner and nonlearner dharmas.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tshul khrims dang chos la shes nas dad pa dag kyang thob par ston to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tshul khrims dang chos la shes nas dad pa dag kyang thob par ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that one also obtains the morality and faith that is born of insight into the Dharma.

original: 'dir gang la chos su dgongs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gang la chos su dgongs pa yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to this, what is the Dharma in which one has faith?

original: chos bden gsum dang rang sangs rgyas //
analyzed: chos bden gsum dang rang sangs rgyas //
translated: The Dharma is the three truths, the pratyekabuddha vehicle,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin no //
translated: and the bodhisattva vehicle.

original: de dag ni dad pa'i gzhi'i bye brag las ming gi sgo nas shes nas dad pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dad pa'i gzhi'i bye brag las ming gi sgo nas shes nas dad pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: These four are called faith through considering, because they are distinguished by their basis, that is, by their object.

original: rdzas su gnyis @196a * //
analyzed: rdzas su gnyis @196a * //
translated: In substance, they are two.

original: te dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa rnams ni dad pa'i rang bzhin dag go //
analyzed: te dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa rnams ni dad pa'i rang bzhin dag go //
translated: Faith through considering the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sa·πÖgha is faith.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams ni tshul khrims kho na'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams ni tshul khrims kho na'o //
translated: Morality approved by the noble ones is morality.

original: shes nas dad pa rnams gcig tu //üîΩdri ma med pa yin /
analyzed: shes nas dad pa rnams gcig tu // dri ma med pa yin /
translated: Faith through considering is pure.

original: zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zag pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is uncontaminated, that is, unmixed with the contaminants.üîΩA s≈´tra declares:

original: mdo las / slob pa rnams ni lam yan lag brgyad dang ldan no //
analyzed: mdo las / slob pa rnams ni lam yan lag brgyad dang ldan no //
translated: Those in training possess the eightfold noble path.

original: mi slob pa rnams ni bcu dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams ni bcu dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Those beyond training possess the ten.

original: ci'i phyir slob pa la yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa ma bshad ce na /üîΩbcings phyir slob pa'i yan lag tu //
analyzed: ci'i phyir slob pa la yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa ma bshad ce na / bcings phyir slob pa'i yan lag tu //
translated: Why are right liberation and right knowledge not explained as being for those in training?

original: rnam grol ma bshad /
analyzed: rnam grol ma bshad /
translated: Liberation is not explained as a branch of those in trainingüîΩbecause they are bound.

original: slob pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i phyogs gcig gis bcings pa yin pas 'di la rnam par grol ba zhes ma gsungs so //
analyzed: slob pa ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba'i phyogs gcig gis bcings pa yin pas 'di la rnam par grol ba zhes ma gsungs so //
translated: The learner is bound by one part of the fetter of the defilements. Therefore, it is not called liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba med pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i shes pa yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba med pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i shes pa yang med do //
translated: And because there is no liberation, there is no knowledge of liberation.

original: de rnam gnyis /
analyzed: de rnam gnyis /
translated: It is twofold.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is conditioned and unconditioned.üîΩAmong them,

original: de la / nyon mongs bcom pa 'dus ma byas /
analyzed: de la / nyon mongs bcom pa 'dus ma byas /
translated: the destruction of the defilements is unconditioned.

original: mos pa 'dus byas //
analyzed: mos pa 'dus byas //
translated: Faith is conditioned.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni rnam grol 'dus ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni rnam grol 'dus ma byas pa yin no //
translated: The abandonment of the defilements is unconditioned liberation.

original: mi slob pa'i mos pa ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mos pa ni 'dus byas so //
translated: Faith of the non-learner is conditioned.

original: yan lag ni /
analyzed: yan lag ni /
translated: The limbs

original: de yin / 'dus byas pa'i mos pa de nyid mi slob pa'i yan lag tu bshad de /
analyzed: de yin / 'dus byas pa'i mos pa de nyid mi slob pa'i yan lag tu bshad de /
translated: are just that. That conditioned faith is explained as a limb of the non-learner.

original: yan lag rnams 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the limbs are conditioned.

original: de nyid rnam grol gnyis /
analyzed: de nyid rnam grol gnyis /
translated: It is twofold liberation.

original: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: It is liberation of mind and liberation by wisdom.

original: byang chub ji skad bshad shes pa //
analyzed: byang chub ji skad bshad shes pa //
translated: One should understand enlightenment as explained.

original: sngar byang chub bshad pa gang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa de nyid 'dir yang dag pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: sngar byang chub bshad pa gang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa de nyid 'dir yang dag pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising which have been explained above as the cognition of the future, are also right cognition.

original: sems ji ltar rnam par grol zhe na /
analyzed: sems ji ltar rnam par grol zhe na /
translated: How is the mind liberated?

original: mi slob sems ni skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mi slob sems ni skye 'gyur ba //
translated: The future mind of those beyond training

original: sgrib pa las ni rnam grol 'gyur //
analyzed: sgrib pa las ni rnam grol 'gyur //
translated: is liberated from the obscurations.

original: mi slob pa'i sems ma 'ongs pa sgrib pa rnams las grol lo //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sems ma 'ongs pa sgrib pa rnams las grol lo //
translated: The future mind of those beyond training is liberated from the obscurations.

original: gnas skabs gang ba'i lam gyis de'i sgrib pa spong zhe na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang ba'i lam gyis de'i sgrib pa spong zhe na /
translated: By what path is the obscuration to it abandoned?

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: The path which is in the process of arising

original: de yi sgrib pa rab tu spong //üîΩda ltar gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yi sgrib pa rab tu spong // da ltar gyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: completely abandons the obscurations to it.üîΩThe path which is in the process of arising abandons the obscurations to the future mind of those beyond training.

original: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas bshad pa gang yin pa dang / khams gsum po spangs pa'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas bshad pa gang yin pa dang / khams gsum po spangs pa'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams zhes 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the unconditioned liberation which has been explained, and the three elements, i.e., the element of abandonment, the element of separation, the element of cessation?

original: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //
translated: The unconditioned itself is called an element.

original: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas pa de nyid khams gsum yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas pa de nyid khams gsum yin no //
translated: This very unconditioned liberation is the three realms.

original: de la yang /üîΩ'dod chags kun zad 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: de la yang / 'dod chags kun zad 'dod chags bral //
translated: In this regard,üîΩthe realm of detachment is the complete exhaustion of attachment.

original: 'dod chags spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral @196b ba'i khams yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags spangs pa ni 'dod chags dang bral @196b ba'i khams yin no //
translated: The realm of detachment is the abandonment of attachment.

original: spangs pa'i khams ni gzhan dag go //
analyzed: spangs pa'i khams ni gzhan dag go //
translated: The realm of abandonment is another.

original: 'dod chags las gzhan nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni spangs pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags las gzhan nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni spangs pa'i khams yin no //
translated: The realm of abandonment is the abandonment of the defilements other than attachment.

original: 'gog pa'i khams zhes bya ba gzhi //üîΩyang dag par zad pa zhes bya ba kho nar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i khams zhes bya ba gzhi // yang dag par zad pa zhes bya ba kho nar sbyar te /
translated: The realm of cessation is the basis of abandonment.üîΩThe realm of cessation is the complete abandonment of the defilements.üîΩThe realm of abandonment is the abandonment of the defilements other than attachment.

original: nyon mongs pa la ma gtogs pa'i gzhi spong ba ni 'gog pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la ma gtogs pa'i gzhi spong ba ni 'gog pa'i khams yin no //
translated: The realm of cessation is the basis of abandonment that is not included among the defilements.

original: dngos po gang gis yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po des 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po gang gis yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po des 'dod chags dang bral bar yang 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Is one detached from a thing by the same thing through which one becomes disgusted with it?üîΩThere are four alternatives.

original: mu bzhi'o // ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: mu bzhi'o // ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this?

original: sdug bsngal rgyu bzod shes rnams kyis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu bzod shes rnams kyis //
translated: By the receptivities and cognitions of unsatisfactoriness and of its origin.

original: yid 'byung / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kho nas yid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yid 'byung / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kho nas yid 'byung ngo //
translated: Disgust, disgust alone, is produced by the Patiences and the Knowledges of unsatisfactoriness and of the origin, because these two Truths are the cause of disgust.

original: gang gis spong 'gyur ba /üîΩkun gyi 'dod chags bral bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis spong 'gyur ba / kun gyi 'dod chags bral bar 'gyur //
translated: What abandons?üîΩAll the Patiences and Knowledges of the Doctrine and of the Investigation of the Path and of the Truth of the Path, because they are opposed to the defilements.üîΩWhat detaches?

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa la bzod pa dang shes pa dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa la bzod pa dang shes pa dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: All the Patiences and Knowledges of unsatisfactoriness, of the origin, of cessation, because they are opposed to the defilements of the realm of desire.

original: de lta na ni mu bzhi srid //
analyzed: de lta na ni mu bzhi srid //
translated: There are four alternatives:

original: de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la bzod pa dang ; shes pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa mi spong na yid 'byung ba kho na yin no //üîΩ'gog pa dang lam la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dag spong na 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la bzod pa dang ; shes pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa mi spong na yid 'byung ba kho na yin no // 'gog pa dang lam la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dag spong na 'dod chags dang bral ba kho na yin no //
translated: 1. The Patiences and the Knowledges of unsatisfactoriness and of the origin do not abandon the defilements; they produce disgust alone.üîΩ2. The Patiences and the Knowledges of cessation and of the Path abandon the defilements; they detach one from the defilements.

original: snga ma rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dag spong na gnyis ka yin no //
analyzed: snga ma rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dag spong na gnyis ka yin no //
translated: 3. The Patiences and the Knowledges of the Doctrine and of the Investigation of the Path, when they are the first Patiences and the first Knowledges, abandon the defilements and produce disgust.üîΩ4. The other Patiences and Knowledges do neither one nor the other.

original: phyi ma rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dag mi spong na gnyis ka ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dag mi spong na gnyis ka ma yin no //
translated: If the latter do not abandon afflictions, they are neither.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig bden pa rnams la lta na chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dag mi spong ngo //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig bden pa rnams la lta na chos shes pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa dag mi spong ngo //
translated: If one who is free from attachment by the mundane path views the four truths, he does not abandon afflictions by means of the perseverance for Dharma knowledge.üîΩHe also does not abandon them by means of the subsequent knowledge of the truth of path, since that is subsumed by the path of meditation.

original: shes pa rnams kyis sbyor ba dang // rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam gyis bsdus pa rnams kyang mi spong ngo //
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyis sbyor ba dang // rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam gyis bsdus pa rnams kyang mi spong ngo //
translated: He also does not abandon them by means of the knowledge of the truth of path, since that is subsumed by the path of preparation, the liberated path and the special path.

original: lam dang gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas drug pa'o /
analyzed: lam dang gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas drug pa'o /
translated: The sixth chapter on the exposition of the path and the person is completed.

original: // / bzod pa rnams dang / zhes pa rnams dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba rnams dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes kyang 'byung na /
analyzed: // / bzod pa rnams dang / zhes pa rnams dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba rnams dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa zhes kyang 'byung na /
translated: Since it is said that perseverance, the correct views, and correct knowledge exist,

original: ci bzod pa dag yin la shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci bzod pa dag yin la shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: are there any that are perseverance but not knowledge?

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa yin la yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa yin la yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are there any that are correct knowledge but not correct view?

original: dri med bzod rnams shes pa min //
analyzed: dri med bzod rnams shes pa min //
translated: Uncontaminated perseverance is not knowledge.

original: des spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas the tshom ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas the tshom ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the proclivity of doubt which should be abandoned by means of this path is not abandoned.

original: de dag yang dag par rtog pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir lta ba dag yin no //üîΩji ltar bzod pa rnams lta ba yin gyi shes pa rnams ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag yang dag par rtog pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir lta ba dag yin no // ji ltar bzod pa rnams lta ba yin gyi shes pa rnams ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: The views are the view of the transitory aggregates and the esteeming of views, because they have the nature of investigation and research.üîΩJust as the receptivities are views but not cognitions,

original: zad dang mi skye'i blo lta min //üîΩyang @197a * //
analyzed: zad dang mi skye'i blo lta min // yang @197a * //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are not views.üîΩBecause they do not have the nature of investigation and research,

original: dag par rtog pa med pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag par rtog pa med pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are free from conceptualization and investigation.üîΩThe other is both.

original: de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyis ka / bzod pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag las gzhan pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni lta ba dang shes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyis ka / bzod pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag las gzhan pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni lta ba dang shes pa yang yin no //
translated: The other, i.e., the pure understanding other than the receptivities, the cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising, is both view and cognition.üîΩThe other is cognition.

original: gzhan shes / 'jig rten gyi shes rab bo //
analyzed: gzhan shes / 'jig rten gyi shes rab bo //
translated: The mundane understanding is cognition.

original: drug ni lta ba'ang yin /
analyzed: drug ni lta ba'ang yin /
translated: Six are also views.

original: lta ba lnga dang / 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang 'jig rten pa'i shes rab rnam pa de drug lta ba yin gyi gzhan ni lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ba lnga dang / 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang 'jig rten pa'i shes rab rnam pa de drug lta ba yin gyi gzhan ni lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The five views, the correct mundane view, and mundane wisdom are the six types of views. The others are not views.

original: 'di dag dang gzhan dag kyang shes pa ni yin no //üîΩji snyed cig gis shes pa thams cad bsdus she na /
analyzed: 'di dag dang gzhan dag kyang shes pa ni yin no // ji snyed cig gis shes pa thams cad bsdus she na /
translated: The others are knowledge.üîΩHow many knowledges are there?

original: shes pa bcu bsdus so //
analyzed: shes pa bcu bsdus so //
translated: In brief, there are ten knowledges.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: knowledge is contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: de gnyis las kyang /
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang /
translated: Among those two,

original: dang po kun rdzob ces bya'o //
analyzed: dang po kun rdzob ces bya'o //
translated: the first is called conventional.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob shes pa yin no //
translated: That which is contaminated is conventional knowledge.

original: zag med rnam gnyis chos dang ni //
analyzed: zag med rnam gnyis chos dang ni //
translated: Uncontaminated knowledge is twofold:

original: rjes su shes pa kho na yin //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa kho na yin //
translated: knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge.

original: shes pa gnyis po de dag ni gsum yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gnyis po de dag ni gsum yin no //
translated: These two knowledges are threefold.

original: de la kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do //üîΩkun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do // kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos thams cad do //
translated: Conventional knowledge has all as its object.üîΩConventional knowledge has all phenomena as its object.

original: chos shes bya ba'i spyod yul ni //
analyzed: chos shes bya ba'i spyod yul ni //
translated: Knowledge of the doctrine has

original: 'dod sdug bsngal sogs /
analyzed: 'dod sdug bsngal sogs /
translated: the truth of suffering, etc.üîΩas its object field.

original: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams yin no //üîΩrjes shes pa'i /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / de'i kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam rnams yin no // rjes shes pa'i /
translated: The object-field of the cognition of the factors is the unsatisfactoriness, the origin, the cessation, the path of the realm of desire.

original: spyod yul gong ma'i sdug bsngal sogs //
analyzed: spyod yul gong ma'i sdug bsngal sogs //
translated: The object-field of the subsequent cognition is the unsatisfactoriness, etc., of the higher realms.

original: rjes su shes pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o //üîΩde dag nyid bden bye brag gis //üîΩbzhi ste / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams yin te /üîΩde la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i dmigs pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o // de dag nyid bden bye brag gis // bzhi ste / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams yin te / de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object-field of the subsequent cognition is the unsatisfactoriness, etc., of the realm of fine-materiality and of the realm of immateriality.üîΩThese cognitions are fourfold by reason of the distinction of the truths.

original: rnam bzhi de dag ni /
analyzed: rnam bzhi de dag ni /
translated: They are the cognition of the factors, the subsequent cognition, the cognition of the truth of unsatisfactoriness, the cognition of the truth of the origin, the cognition of the truth of cessation, the cognition of the truth of the path.

original: mi skye ba dang zad pa shes //
analyzed: mi skye ba dang zad pa shes //
translated: They are called cognition of exhaustion and cognition of non-arising.

original: de dag chos dang rjes su shes pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de dag chos dang rjes su shes pa bzhi ste /
translated: These two cognitions are the fourth of each of the four cognitions of the doctrine and the subsequent cognitions.

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde gnyis dang po skyes pa ni //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya'o // de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, in this order, the fourth of the cognitions of the doctrine and the subsequent cognitions.üîΩThe first of these two cognitions is the cognition of the factors with regard to the path.

original: sdug bsngal rgyu rjes shes pa yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu rjes shes pa yin //
translated: The first of these two cognitions is the cognition of the factors with regard to the path.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi rnam pa rnams kyis srid pa'i rtse mo'i phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung gi rnam pa rnams kyis srid pa'i rtse mo'i phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspects of suffering and origin are the aspects of the truths of suffering and origin, because they focus on the aggregates of the summit of existence.

original: bzhi las pha rol sems rig pa //
analyzed: bzhi las pha rol sems rig pa //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is four.

original: pha rol gyi sems rig pa ni chos dang rjes su shes pa dang / lam dang / kun rdzob shes pa rnams su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems rig pa ni chos dang rjes su shes pa dang / lam dang / kun rdzob shes pa rnams su blta bar bya'o //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds should be viewed as being Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, the path of preparation, and conventional knowledge.

original: de'i nges pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩdes ni sa dbang gang zag 'das //
analyzed: de'i nges pa ni 'di yin te / des ni sa dbang gang zag 'das //
translated: Its determination is as follows.üîΩIt does not know past or future,

original: zhig dang ma skyes mi rig go //
analyzed: zhig dang ma skyes mi rig go //
translated: nor that which is destroyed or unarisen.

original: sa 'das pa mi rig pa ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i sa pas bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: sa 'das pa mi rig pa ni bsam gtan 'og ma'i sa pas bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pa'o //
translated: It does not know past levels, because the level of lower absorption does not know the level of higher absorption.

original: dbang po @197b 'das pa mi shes pa ni dad pas mos pa dang / dus kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: dbang po @197b 'das pa mi shes pa ni dad pas mos pa dang / dus kyi rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam mo //
translated: It does not know superior faculties, because the path of resolute faith and the liberated being of the time of meditative equipoise does not know the path of seeing and the liberated being not bound to another occasion.

original: gang zag 'das pa mi shes pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam 'og mas gong ma'o //
analyzed: gang zag 'das pa mi shes pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang dgra bcom pa dang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi lam 'og mas gong ma'o //
translated: Non-knowledge of the past is the non-knowledge of the path of the non-returner, the arhat, the sravaka, the pratyekabuddha, and the lower stages of the path of the Buddha.

original: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa mi shes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhig pa dang ma skyes pa mi shes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: Non-knowledge of the destroyed and the non-arisen is the non-knowledge of the past and the future.

original: gzhan yang / chos rje blo phyogs phan tshun min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / chos rje blo phyogs phan tshun min //
translated: Moreover, the Dharma is not the sphere of the mind of another.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pas chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas kyang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems mi shes so //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pas chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pas kyang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i sems mi shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another does not know the mind associated with the knowledge of dharmas, nor the mind associated with the subsequent knowledge.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi gzhan yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi gzhan yang ngo //
translated: It is the same for the knowledge of the mind of another of the other stages.

original: ma thob pa'i lam la pha rol gyi sems shes pa med do //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i lam la pha rol gyi sems shes pa med do //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another does not know the path that has not been attained.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni yod de /
translated: But it has for its object the path that has been attained.

original: de la pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba'i lam shes par 'dod pas sbyor ba byas pa /
analyzed: de la pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba'i lam shes par 'dod pas sbyor ba byas pa /
translated: In order to know the path of insight, the knowledge of the mind of another of the realm of desire is applied.

original: nyan thos mthong ba'i skad cig gnyis //
analyzed: nyan thos mthong ba'i skad cig gnyis //
translated: The sravaka knows two moments of the path of insight.

original: rig ste bse ru lta bus gsum //
analyzed: rig ste bse ru lta bus gsum //
translated: The rhinoceros knows three.

original: sangs rgyas sbyor ba med par kun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sbyor ba med par kun //
translated: The Buddha knows all without preparatory effort.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pas skad cig ma gnyis shes pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pas skad cig ma gnyis shes pa ste /
translated: When one knows another's thoughts, one knows two moments.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa'o //
translated: One knows the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness and the cognition of the factors.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa la dmigs pa ni sbyor ba gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa la dmigs pa ni sbyor ba gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to the origin of unsatisfactoriness, etc., and the subsequent receptivity and subsequent cognition are the object of another preparatory effort.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis ni dang po gnyis dang / brgyad pa kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa dang / gsum shes te sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ni dang po gnyis dang / brgyad pa kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa dang / gsum shes te sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir /
translated: The Pratyekabuddha knows three moments: the first two and the eighth, i.e., the subsequent cognition of the origin of unsatisfactoriness.

original: gzhan dag na re dang po dang gnyis pa dang bco lnga pa rnams shes so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dang po dang gnyis pa dang bco lnga pa rnams shes so zhes zer ro //
translated: According to others, he knows three moments: the first, the second and the fifteenth.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni sbyor ba med par mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma thams cad mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni sbyor ba med par mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma thams cad mkhyen to //
translated: The Buddha knows all the moments of the path of insight without preparatory effort.

original: yang zad pa shes pa dang mi shes pa dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yang zad pa shes pa dang mi shes pa dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of non-arising?

original: zad pa shes pa bden rnams la //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa bden rnams la //
translated: The knowledge of destruction is the knowledge of the destruction of all the proclivities.

original: yongs shes pa la sogs nges pa'o //
analyzed: yongs shes pa la sogs nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of complete knowledge, etc.

original: yongs shes byar med ces la sogs //
analyzed: yongs shes byar med ces la sogs //
translated: The certainty that there is nothing to be completely known, etc.

original: mi skye ba yi blor 'dod do //üîΩsdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams la yongs su shes /
analyzed: mi skye ba yi blor 'dod do // sdug bsngal la sogs pa rnams la yongs su shes /
translated: Is asserted to be the cognition of nonarising.

original: spangs mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: spangs mngon sum du byas /
translated: The certainty of complete knowledge, abandonment, realization, and cultivation with regard to the truths of suffering, etc.

original: bsgoms pa nyid kyi nges pa ni zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa nyid kyi nges pa ni zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: is the cognition of exhaustion.

original: de bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba med pa nas bsgom par bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nges pa ni mi skye ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yongs su shes par bya ba med pa nas bsgom par bya ba med do zhes bya ba'i bar gyis nges pa ni mi skye ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: Similarly, the certainty that there is nothing to be completely known, up to nothing to be cultivated, is the cognition of nonarising.

original: de ltar de dag ni shes pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni shes pa bcu ste /
translated: Thus there are ten cognitions:

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes @198a * //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes @198a * //
translated: cognition of dharmas, subsequent cognition, cognition of the conventional, cognition of others' minds, cognition of suffering, cognition of origin, cognition of cessation, cognition of the path, cognition of exhaustion, and cognition of nonarising.

original: pa'o // ci'i phyir de dag gsum yod la bcur rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: pa'o // ci'i phyir de dag gsum yod la bcur rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are they established as ten when they exist as three?

original: rang bzhin dang ni gnyen po dang // rnam pa rnam pa spyod yul dang // sbyor dang bya ba byas nyid dang // rgyu byas pa las bcu yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni gnyen po dang // rnam pa rnam pa spyod yul dang // sbyor dang bya ba byas nyid dang // rgyu byas pa las bcu yin no //
translated: The ten cognitions are due to: nature, counteraction, aspect, object, application, function, and cause of function.

original: rang bzhin las ni kun rdzob shes pa ste //
analyzed: rang bzhin las ni kun rdzob shes pa ste //
translated: From the point of view of nature, conventional cognition is one.

original: don dam pa ni mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa ni mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not ultimate cognition, because it does not have the ultimate truth for its object.

original: gnyen po las ni chos dang rjes su shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: gnyen po las ni chos dang rjes su shes pa dag ste /
translated: From the point of view of counteraction, cognition of the factors and subsequent cognition are two.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / khams gong ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / khams gong ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are, respectively, the counteraction of the realm of desire and the counteraction of the higher realms.

original: rnam pa las ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung ba shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa las ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung ba shes pa dag ste /
translated: From the point of view of aspect, cognition of unsatisfactoriness and cognition of the origin are two.

original: rdzas la dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas la dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have the same object, namely, the unsatisfactoriness and the origin in the realm of desire.

original: rnam pa dang dmigs pa las ni 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dang dmigs pa las ni 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag ste /
translated: From the point of view of aspect and object, cognition of cessation and cognition of the path are two.

original: rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have different aspects and different objects.

original: sbyor ba las ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba las ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa ste /
translated: From the point of view of application, cognition of another's thoughts is one.

original: sems shes par bya ba'i don du sbyor ba byas pa las grub pa'i phyir sems las byung ba yang shes so //
analyzed: sems shes par bya ba'i don du sbyor ba byas pa las grub pa'i phyir sems las byung ba yang shes so //
translated: The cognition of the mind of another is also the cognition of the factors, because it is produced through the power of the cognition of the factors.

original: bya ba byas pa las ni zad pa shes pa lta /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa las ni zad pa shes pa lta /
translated: The cognition of exhaustion is produced through the power of the cognition of destruction.

original: bya ba byas pa'i rgyud la dngos po nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyu rgyas pa las ni mi skye ba shes pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa'i rgyud la dngos po nyid du skye ba'i phyir ro // rgyu rgyas pa las ni mi skye ba shes pa ste /
translated: It is produced in the stream of one who has already done what had to be done.üîΩThe cognition of non-arising is produced through the power of the cognition of the totality of causes.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthams cad kyi gnyen po thams cad yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po zhes bshad par zad kyi /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa thams cad kyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro // thams cad kyi gnyen po thams cad yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po zhes bshad par zad kyi /
translated: It is produced in the stream of one who has the totality of causes of all the pure cognitions.üîΩThe cognition of the factors is the counter-agent of the realm of desire, but not of the other two realms.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa'i lam //üîΩlam la chos shes gang yin de //üîΩkhams gsum gyi ni gnyen po yin //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa'i lam // lam la chos shes gang yin de // khams gsum gyi ni gnyen po yin //
translated: The cognition of the factors and the subsequent cognition, when they are the path of cultivation, are the counter-agent of the three realms.üîΩThe cognition of the factors and the subsequent cognition, when they are the path of cultivation, are the counter-agent of the three realms.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dag ni khams gsum char gyi gnyen po yin no //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams kyi rjes ma yin //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa dag ni khams gsum char gyi gnyen po yin no //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams kyi rjes ma yin //
translated: The cognition of the factors and the subsequent cognition, when they are the path of cultivation, are the counter-agent of the three realms.üîΩThe cognition of the factors and the subsequent cognition, when they are the path of cultivation, are the counter-agent of the three realms.

original: shes pa bcu po de dag las //
analyzed: shes pa bcu po de dag las //
translated: From among these ten knowledges,

original: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes //
translated: the knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledgeüîΩhave sixteen aspects.

original: rnam pa bcu drug / de dag ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug / de dag ni 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: They will be explained below.üîΩConventional knowledge

original: kun rdzob ni /üîΩde bzhin gzhan du 'ong /üîΩrnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni / de bzhin gzhan du 'ong / rnam pa bcu drug dang ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: is of the nature of all aspects.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can yang yin te /
translated: It is also of the nature of other aspects,

original: chos thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it grasps the specific and general characteristics of all things.

original: rang rang gi bden pa'i rnam pas bzhi yin no //
analyzed: rang rang gi bden pa'i rnam pas bzhi yin no //
translated: Each of the four truths has four aspects.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa rnams ni rang rang gi bden pa'i rnam pa dag tu 'jug pa re re zhing rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la sogs pa rnams ni rang rang gi bden pa'i rnam pa dag tu 'jug pa re re zhing rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin no //
translated: Each of the four truths, such as the truth of suffering, has four aspects, such as impermanence, that are engaged by the knowledge of the doctrine of suffering.

original: pha rol yid shes dri med kyang //
analyzed: pha rol yid shes dri med kyang //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds and also the stainless

original: de bzhin rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin rnam pa bzhi dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: have four aspects in the same way.

original: lam shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have four aspects, such as impermanence, because they are knowledge of the path.

original: dri ma dang bcas ni /
analyzed: dri ma dang bcas ni /
translated: Knowledge with impurity

original: shes bya'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnam //
analyzed: shes bya'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnam //
translated: has the aspects of the specific characteristics of the object of knowledge.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni shes bya sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de @198b ni rnam pa 'dzin pa'o //üîΩgnyis ka yang /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni shes bya sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de @198b ni rnam pa 'dzin pa'o // gnyis ka yang /
translated: The object of knowledge that is contaminated is the individual characteristic of the mind and mental factors.üîΩBoth are the apprehended object.üîΩ

original: rdzas re re zhig spyod yul lo //üîΩgang gi tshe sems 'dzin pa de'i tshe sems las byung ba rnams mi 'dzin la /üîΩgang gi tshe tshor ba 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'du shes mi 'dzin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas re re zhig spyod yul lo // gang gi tshe sems 'dzin pa de'i tshe sems las byung ba rnams mi 'dzin la / gang gi tshe tshor ba 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'du shes mi 'dzin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //

translated: They are associated with the realm of desire, the realm of fine-materiality, the realm of immateriality, the pure realm.üîΩThe cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising have nine factors as their cognitive object, with the exception of unconditioned neutral factors.

original: 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs so //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising have nine factors as their cognitive object, with the exception of unconditioned neutral factors.

original: shes pa gcig gis thams cad shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa gcig gis thams cad shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /

original: med do // 'on kyang /
analyzed: med do // 'on kyang /

original: kun rdzob gcig pus rang tshogs las //
analyzed: kun rdzob gcig pus rang tshogs las //
translated: by means of the conventional cognition alone,

original: gzhan ni bdag med nyid rig 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni bdag med nyid rig 'gyur //

analyzed: kun rdzob shes pas ni rang gi tshogs las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad ni bdag med pa'o zhes bdag med pa nyid du shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩde ni rdzogs so //üîΩgang zhig shes pa du dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya ste /üîΩre zhig so so'i skye bo ni kun rdzob shes pa gcig pu dang ldan no //
translated: By means of the conventional cognition, one cognizes the selflessness of all factors, with the exception of itself, for all factors are included in the category of factors.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang yang ngo //
translated: If one is free from attachment, one also possesses knowledge of others' minds.

original: 'phags pa ni /üîΩzag med skad cig dang po la //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni / zag med skad cig dang po la //
translated: AryasüîΩpossess one knowledge in the first moment of uncontaminated

analyzed: chags bcas shes pa gcig dang ldan // 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig yin na sdug bsngal la chos @200a * //
translated: knowledge.

original: shes pa'i bzod pa la kun rdzob shes pa gcig kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: shes pa'i bzod pa la kun rdzob shes pa gcig kho na dang ldan no //
translated: If one is not free from attachment to the desire realm, one possesses one conventional knowledge alone, since one possesses perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: gnyis pa la gsum /
analyzed: gnyis pa la gsum /
translated: One possesses three in the second moment.üîΩOne possesses three conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge and knowledge of the truth of suffering in the second moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.üîΩOne possesses four in the third moment.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la ni kun rdzob shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa ste gsum dang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la ni kun rdzob shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa ste gsum dang ngo //
translated: One possesses four conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge and knowledge of the truth of suffering in the third moment of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.üîΩOne possesses five in the fourth moment.üîΩOne possesses five conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the truth of suffering and knowledge of the truth of origin in the fourth moment of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: yan chad ni /
analyzed: yan chad ni /
translated: One possesses six in the fifth moment.üîΩOne possesses six conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the truth of suffering, knowledge of the truth of origin and knowledge of the truth of cessation in the fifth moment of Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin.

original: bzhi la re re 'phel dang ldan //üîΩsdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa la ni rjes su shes pa 'phel la /
analyzed: bzhi la re re 'phel dang ldan // sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa la ni rjes su shes pa 'phel la /
translated: One possesses seven in the sixth moment.üîΩOne possesses seven conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the truth of suffering, knowledge of the truth of origin, knowledge of the truth of cessation and knowledge of the truth of path in the sixth moment of subsequent knowledge of the truth of origin.üîΩOne possesses eight in the seventh moment.

original: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams la ni de dag kho na 'phel lo //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa rnams la ni de dag kho na 'phel lo //
translated: One possesses eight conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the truth of suffering, knowledge of the truth of origin, knowledge of the truth of cessation, knowledge of the truth of path and knowledge of elimination in the seventh moment of Dharma knowledge of the truth of path.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du gzhan gyi sems shes pa lhag par ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du gzhan gyi sems shes pa lhag par ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: If they are free from attachment, they should be known as possessing the knowledge of others' minds in all cases.

original: yang gnas skabs gang du shes pa du zhig 'thob ce na /üîΩmthong ba'i lam la bzod pa dang // shes pa ji ltar skyes pa rnams //

original: ma 'ongs pa 'thob /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'thob /
translated: On the path of insight, one obtains future receptivities and knowledgesüîΩin the same way that they arise.

original: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa'am shes pa gang dang gang skyes pa dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi kho na 'thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩde nyid la /üîΩrjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang //

translated: On the path of insight, one obtains future receptivities and knowledges in the same way that they arise.üîΩOn the three subsequent paths, one also obtains conventional knowledge.

original: mthong ba'i lam de nyid la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa gsum la kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de nyid la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa gsum la kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //

original: chos shes pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa la ni ma yin te /

original: bden pa zad par mngon par ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa zad par mngon par ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir mngon rtogs mtha' zhes bya //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon rtogs mtha' zhes bya //

original: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob shes pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir kun rdzob shes pa de ni mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las 'byung ba'o //

analyzed: nam yang mi byed / de mtha' gcig tu /
translated: No, it is never actualized.üîΩIt is always future.

original: de ni mi skye'i chos can yin //
analyzed: de ni mi skye'i chos can yin //

original: sa du pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: sa du pa'i kun rdzob shes pa de 'thob ce na /

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis ni /
translated: The conventional cognition of the path of insight

original: rang dang 'og sa /
analyzed: rang dang 'og sa /

analyzed: mthong ba'i lam sa gang yin pa'i sa de ba dang / 'og ma'i kun rdzob shes pa 'thob ste /
translated: The conventional cognition of the path of insight belongs to the level of the path itself or to a lower level.

analyzed: gal te mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni de nyid kyi sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa 'thob bo //
translated: If the path of insight is of the level of the preliminary concentration, the conventional cognition belongs to this level or to the level of the realm of desire.

analyzed: 'gog pa'i mtha'/ 'gog pa mngon par rtogs pa las chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //

analyzed: lhag ma dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char ro //

original: de yang 'di mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba ni /
analyzed: de yang 'di mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba ni /

original: rang bden rnam can 'bad las byung //
analyzed: rang bden rnam can 'bad las byung //
translated: It arises from effort, possessing the aspect of its truth.

original: bden pa gang zhig mngon par rtogs pas thob pa de ni bden pa'i rnam pa can kho na'o //
analyzed: bden pa gang zhig mngon par rtogs pas thob pa de ni bden pa'i rnam pa can kho na'o //

original: de la / 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni //
analyzed: de la / 'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni //

analyzed: sprul pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su skye'o //
